titlestmt.titleproper: Allen Family Collection of Kennedy-Johnson Inaugural Ephemera
Finding Aid for the Allen Family Collection of Kennedy-Johnson Inaugural Ephemera LSC.1751
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aislinn Catherine Sotelo; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-31 10:34:33 -0700.

did.unittitle: Allen family collection of Kennedy-Johnson inaugural ephemera
did.abstract: The collection consists mainly of ephemera and printed material, a ball gown worn by the donor's mother to the Inauguration Ball, publications such as "Life" and "Look" and newspapers which cover the Kennedy inauguration and assassination. This collection also includes ephemera from the California Governor Brown's Inauguration.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Allen Family Collection of Kennedy-Johnson Inaugural Ephemera (Collection 1751). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Judith A. and Gene Tuch in memory of Marian and Albert H. Allen, 2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Aislinn Catherine Sotelo with assistance from Elizabeth Sheehan, Spring 2007, in the Center For Primary Research and Training (CFPRT).

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Marian and Albert H. Allen attended the Kennedy-Johnson Inauguration in 1961. Marian Allen (1917-2003) and Albert H. Allen (d. 2002) married in 1939. Mr. Allen was one of the longest practicing attorneys in California, practicing real estate law in Beverly Hills for nearly 70 years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The John F. Kennedy Collection of Inaugural and Assassination Ephemera consists of invitations and tickets from the John F. Kennedy Presidential Inauguration, menus, magazines, newspapers and the ball gown worn by the donor's mother, Marian Allen, to the Inauguration Ball. Publications such as "Life" and "Look" cover the Kennedy inauguration and assassination as well as newspapers and newspaper clippings from Los Angeles and Washington. This collection also includes ephemera from the California Governor Brown's Inauguration. The bulk of the collection dates from 1961-1963.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
John F. Kennedy inaugural material
Edmund G. Brown inaugural material

did.unittitle: Campaign button for John F. Kennedy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to the Inaugural Ball with envelope and RSVP card. 5 items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Engraved invitation, hard card stock sheet, and envelope.

did.unittitle: Invitation to Inaugural Gala from the Democratic National Committee at the Armory
Invitation to reception honoring Mr. James Edward Day, Postmaster General-Designate
Official Inaugural photo of Marian and Albert H. Allen in Ball Gown with official seal 8x10" black and white photo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Marian Allen is wearing the I Magnin ball gown in this photo, which is part of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The official Inaugural Program for John F. Kennedy and Lyndon B. Johnson, January 20, 1961 with envelope.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two Inaugural Gala programs in honor of the inauguration of John Fitzgerald Kennedy and Lyndon Baines Johnson at the Armory, Washington D.C. Includes photographs of Jacqueline Kennedy, John F. Kennedy, Lady Bird Johnson, Lydon B. Johnson, Harry S. Truman, Eleanor Roosevelt, and gala entertainers: Harry Belafonte, Milton Berle, Leonard Bernstein, Joey Bishop, Nat Cole, Tony Curtis, Bette Davis, Jimmy Durante, Ella Fitzgerald, Mahalia Jackson, Gene Kelly, Alan King, Peter Lawford, Janet Leigh, Frederic March, Ethel Merman, Sir Laurence Olivier, Sidney Poitier, Keely Smith, Louis Prima, Juliet Prowse, Anthony Quinn, Nelson Riddle, Frank Sinatra, Pat Suzuki, and Helen Traubel.

list.item: 3 Texas State Society Reception honoring VP elect Lyndon B. Johnson tickets
1 Democratic National Committee Inaugural Gala contribution card for free ticket.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Magazine: "Life: December 6, 1963, 25¢ Caption reads, "Mrs. Kennedy, Caroline and John Jr. wait to join procession to capitol."

did.unittitle: Post: In Memoriam: A senseless tragedy, the New President

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Magazine "Post: The Saturday Evening Post December 14, 1963 20¢: In Memoriam: A Senseless Tragedy, The New President, John F. Kennedy 1917-1963" Portrait on front cover by Norman Rockwell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p:
Portions or whole of the following newspapers:
The Washington Post, January 20, 1961
The Washington Post, January 21, 1961
Citizen-News (Los Angeles), November 22,1963
Herald Examiner (Los Angeles), November 22, 1963 (2 copies)
Times Classified Ads (Los Angeles), November 23,1963
The Los Angeles Times, November 23, 1963
The New York Times, November 25, 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: I Magnin ball gown worn by Mrs. Allen to the Kennedy-Johnson Inauguration.

list.item: Invitation from the California Democratic Congressional Delegation to a Brunch for Californians at the Mayflower Hotel
Democratic National Committee Memorandum Re Inauguration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inaugural Ceremony and Joint Legislative Session Program. 2 copies.

scopecontent.p: California Governor Brown's Inaugural Sacramento Tour Program.
